availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert P. Henry (Woodford County, Kentucky soldier and sculpter)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, soldier and sculpter. Kentucky native. Son of C.B. Henry and Angeline Henry. Married to Rebecca Trimble Davis Henry on January 24, 1872 in Bourbon County, Kentucky. Served in 15th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as Lt. Col. from to March 31, 1864. Taken prisoner of war at Spring Creek, Tennessee on June 29, 1863 and held as a prisoner of war until paroled on March 31, 1864. Sculpter of bust of Abraham Lincoln, working in Washington D.C. in November 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 2, p. 461B.
Find A Grave, "Albert P. Henry (1836-1872)," Memorial #191616284, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/191616284 (accessed April 6, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000183145, p. 191.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #257,595, Certificate #194,484.
"Yesterday at the Academy, The Bust of Lincoln Inaugural Ceremonies, Remarks of Governor Bramlette, and Oration of Hon. James Speed, A Large and Appreciative Audience"The Courier-Journal(Louisville, Ky.), February 13, 1867, p. 2.
